text:
Would it make sense to run benchmarks in Kubernetes in GCP (for instance)? One service/pod per language.
If the base image is the same, and you give each the same computing resources, it should be fair?

elements.text:
Would it make sense to run benchmarks in Kubernetes in GCP (for instance)? One service/pod per language.
If the base image is the same, and you give each the same computing resources, it should be fair?

text: Probably. Kubernetes itself doesn’t have any overhead at runtime (other than the networking overhead that comes with containerization). For cpu bound stuff it should be fair. Interestingly, CPU limits are very unintuitive so make sure to check that out. (I might be wrong about some of this but this is my reasonably confident assessment)

elements.text: Probably. Kubernetes itself doesn’t have any overhead at runtime (other than the networking overhead that comes with containerization). For cpu bound stuff it should be fair.
